definitions.definition: A custom or practice of a society or community .
examples: The institution of marriage is present in many cultures but its details vary widely across them.

definitions.definition: A long established and respected organization , particularly one involved with education , public service , or charity work.
examples: The University of the South Pacific is the only internationally accredited institution of higher education in Oceania.

definitions.definition: The building or buildings which house such an organization .
examples: He's been in an institution since the crash.

definitions.definition: Any facility where people (especially those who are mentally or physically disabled or sick, or who are prisoners) are committed ( confined ), where their freedom to leave is restricted.
Any long established and respected place or business .
examples: Over time, the local pub has become something of an institution .

definitions.definition: A person long established in a place , position , or field .
examples: She's not just any old scholar; she is an institution .
The institution of higher speed limits was a popular move but increased the severity of crashes.

definitions.definition: The act by which a bishop commits a cure of souls to a priest . (Can we clean up this sense?)
That which institutes or instructs , particularly a textbook or system of elements or rules .

main_definition: A custom or practice of a society or community .
secondary_definitions: A long established and respected organization , particularly one involved with education , public service , or charity work.
The building or buildings which house such an organization .
Any facility where people (especially those who are mentally or physically disabled or sick, or who are prisoners) are committed ( confined ), where their freedom to leave is restricted.
( informal ) Any long established and respected place or business .
( informal ) A person long established in a place , position , or field .
( Christianity ) The act by which a bishop commits a cure of souls to a priest . (Can we clean up this sense?)
( obsolete ) That which institutes or instructs , particularly a textbook or system of elements or rules .
